channel.title: flutter on Carmine Zaccagnino's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in flutter on Carmine Zaccagnino's Blog

item.title: Advanced Flutter Networking Part 2: User Authentication + JWT Authorization With Flutter and Node
item.description: Photo by James Sutton on Unsplash The series of posts about advanced networking topics applied to Flutter apps continues. As always, this is meant for people who already have a good understanding of Flutter and know how to use Flutter widgets and the basics of the http library.

item.title: Advanced Flutter Networking Part 1: Uploading a File to a REST API from Flutter Using a Multi-Part (form-data) POST Request
item.description: My Flutter book is pretty light on advanced HTTP networking topics, focusing instead on giving a more well-rounded approach that, when it comes to networking, explains how to use the http networking package for basic requests, shows an example of an app that makes GET requests, and then goes a bit more specific with Firebase.

item.title: The Early Adopter Conundrum and Reacting to Comments
item.description: When you love new stuff but don’t really want to lose old stuff you write this kind of stuff. It’s about tech stuff that’s old and tech stuff that’s new.

item.title: Google's Flutter Framework Could Change Software Forever
item.description: Google is known for moonshot projects. Often they’re just that, without much hope of being brought to fruition in the near future.
